business.headline: Two foreign funds with investment in Adani Group under Sebi scannerThe Adani Group and its 13 offshore investors have been facing an investigation by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) since Hindenburg Research in 2023 alleged improper use of tax havens by the group, triggering a stock sell-off.

Six IndusInd Bank officials under Sebi scanner for insider trading: ReportThe Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is checking the timing of these trades to find out whether the share sales broke Sebi's rules or the bank's own internal code of conduct.

Byju's Raveendran promises comeback despite big setbacks: 'I am not giving up'Byju Raveendran, the founder of the edtech company, Byju's, admitted that the company made some business mistakes during its rapid global expansion.

'Boycott Turkey' hits fashion: Myntra, Ajio stop selling these Turkish labelsThe two leading online fashion platforms have removed Turkish products after growing boycott calls over Turkey's support to Pakistan during the recent India-Pakistan military conflict.
Sensex closes 271 points lower, Nifty below 25,000, Eternal falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 271.17 points to end at 82,059.42, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 74.35 points to close at 24,945.45.

'High salaries may not last forever': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu warns software engineersSridhar Vembu explained that the upcoming changes in software development, especially with large language models (LLMs) and new tools powered by artificial intelligence (AI), might lead to many software jobs being lost.
Vodafone Idea shares drop 10%. Here's whyVodafone Idea share price: Over the last month, Vodafone Idea's stock has gone down by 16.73%. In the last year, it has fallen over 50%.

What's new in ITR Forms for FY 2024-25? 5 key changes you must knowNow taxpayers need to clearly mention the specific TDS section under which tax was deducted from your income. This change applies to ITR forms 1, 2, 3 and 5.

Supreme Court dismisses Vodafone Idea, Airtel plea on AGR interest duesThe court dismissed the writ petitions filed by the telecom operators, calling the move "shocking" and stating that the petitions were "misconceived."

Brent crude slips below $65: These stocks may benefit investorsBrent futures for July delivery were trading at $64.98 a barrel, down 0.66%. This is a steep fall from January, when prices were above $80 a barrel.

Once earning Rs 1.28 crore, metaverse engineer now sidelined by AI and delivering foodShawn Kay has worked in tech for 20 years. He was involved in virtual reality, web development and artificial intelligence. But after being laid off in April last year, things took a turn for the worse. The metaverse boom faded and jobs in that space dried up, especially with the sudden rise of AI tools like ChatGPT.

Dreaming of a job abroad? These are the easiest countries to get a work visaLatvia is the easiest country to get a skilled worker visa. It scored 7.64 out of 10 for ease of entry. The visa itself costs around 83 pounds and typically gets approved in ten working days, according to a study conducted by Remitly.

entertainment.headline: Dhanush meets Tourist Family director Abishan Jeevinth, says he knew it would workDebutant director Abishan Jeevinth has been receiving a lot of appreciation for his film 'Tourist Family', starring Sasikumar and Simran. The latest to join the list is 'Raayan' actor Dhanush.

Nimrat Kaur on fewer work opportunities in films: People thought I moved to USActor Nimrat Kaur reveals how industry assumptions about her moving abroad affected her career opportunities. She discusses her preference for quality roles and interest in exploring new genres like horror and action.

No new films in Andhra, Telangana as exhibitors announce theatre strike from June 1Cinema exhibitors in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana have announced an indefinite shutdown of theatres from June 1, 2025. If the shutdown goes ahead, big June releases, including 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' and 'Thug Life,' may be affected.

Sharmila Tagore in Cannes with daughter Saba ahead of Aranyer Din Ratri screeningVeteran actor Sharmila Tagore and daughter Saba Pataudi arrived at the 2025 Cannes Film Festival for the screening of Satyajit Ray's restored classic 'Aranyer Din Ratri'. The film, that will be showcased in the Cannes Classics section, highlights Ray's timeless storytelling and features an ensemble cast including Tagore, Simi Garewal, and Soumitra Chatterjee.

BTS Jin urges fans not to grab his hand after kiss controversy at BTS FestaDuring the fan event Hi-Seokjin, BTS member Jin asked ARMY not to grab his hand. He also set a condition for when fans should avoid taking pictures.

Suniel Shetty is missing not being part of Border 2: But my son Ahan is thereSuniel Shetty, who was part of the 1997 film 'Border,' talks about its sequel and his son Ahan Shetty being part of it. He also praises Varun Dhawan for taking care of his son on the set.

Adarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor to begin Tu Yaa Main shooting in June. DetailsAdarsh Gourav and Shanaya Kapoor are set to begin shooting for their upcoming thriller 'Tu Yaa Main' in June. Directed by Bejoy Nambiar and produced by Aanand L Rai, the film will release on Valentine's Day 2026.

American Manhunt review: Riveting documentary about hunt for Laden that hits homeReleased-Wed May 14, 2025The timing of the release of 'American Manhunt - Osama bin Laden' on Netflix India may be coincidental. However, that's what exactly makes it feel so personal. The three-part documentary humanises the entire operation - the facts we know, the minds we don't.

Rupali Ganguly reacts to Jyoti Malhotra's arrest over 'spying for Pakistan'Rupali Ganguly slammed YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, accused of spying for Pakistan, on social media. The actor called for stern action against those working against India.

Mission Impossible 8 is yawn fest, messes up great franchise: Kunal KohliFilmmaker Kunal Kohli recently reviewed Tom Cruise's Mission Impossible:8. While expressing his disappointment with the new sequel, he called it a 'yawn fest'.

Indian-origin contestant's Raj Kachori impresses MasterChef Australia judgesChef Depinder Chhibber impressed MasterChef Australia judges with her Raj Kachori dish. The dish evoked strong emotions and highlighted rich Indian street food culture.

How actor Sumanth from Akkineni family carved his niche in Telugu filmsWhile most actors from legacy families chase mass appeal, Sumanth, who belongs to the Akkineni clan, has quietly carved a niche for himself with grounded performances and understated classics.

Suriya 46 begins with director Venky Atluri, actor Mamitha Baiju. PicsActor Suriya's next film, 'Suriya 46' with Venky Atluri has officially been launched with a puja ceremony. Telugu director Trivikram was present as a guest at the ceremony along with Suriya, Venky, Mamitha Baiju, Naga Vamsi and GV Prakash.

Kareena Kapoor skips Guns N' Roses concert, jams with Saif and Taimur insteadKareena Kapoor Khan skipped the much-anticipated Guns N' Roses concert in Mumbai to enjoy a heartwarming guitar jam session at home with husband Saif Ali Khan and son Taimur. Sharing the moment on Instagram, she proudly called them her "own band."

Tom Cruise hugs singer The Weeknd at MI: 8 premiere, fans call it unreal crossoverHollywood actor Tom Cruise and Canadian singer and songwriter, The Weeknd hugged at the Mission: Impossible – Final Reckoning premiere in New York. Fans recalled Tom Cruise's iconic lip-sync battle from 'The Tonight Show', performing The Weeknd's 'Can't Feel My Face'.

John Abraham's The Diplomat, and the 'no muscle-flexing' approach that workedJohn Abraham's 'The Diplomat' is anchored in realism and driven by restraint. The movie brings to life the remarkable true story of Uzma Ahmed and the quiet, calculated world of diplomacy that ultimately saved her. Read to know how the espionage drama delves into the behind-the-scenes operations of international diplomacy, where power moves quietly.

Exclusive: Rahul Bhat on challenges of shooting at Kumbh for his Hollywood debutRahul Bhat unveiled the first look of his Hollywood debut film 'Lost and Found in Kumbh' at Cannes Film Festival 2025. In an exclusive interview, Bhat spoke about the light-hearted comedy that is set against the backdrop of the Kumbh Mela and promises a unique blend of Indian culture and humour.

Tom Cruise eyes Top Gun, Days of Thunder sequels: Thinking many different storiesActor Tom Cruise hinted at potential sequels to 'Top Gun: Maverick' and 'Days of Thunder' sequels. In an interview for the film, he said he is currently discussing 'many different stories'.

Guns N' Roses set Mumbai ablaze with a nostalgic, no-holds-barred rock spectacleAfter a 13-year hiatus, Guns N' Roses delivered a powerful and memorable concert in Mumbai, winning hearts with their classic hits. The band's energetic performance and crowd interaction made it a night to remember for fans.

general news.headline: No US role in ceasefire, no nuclear signalling from Pak, Parliament panel toldNo US role in ceasefire, no nuclear signalling from Pak, Foreign Secretary tells parliament panel: Sources

From Jyoti Malhotra to Devender Singh: 11 'Pak spies' caught in India over 3 daysA YouTuber, security guard and an app developer were among the 11 people caught red-handed by the police for allegedly passing on sensitive information about India's national security and military to Pakistan.

India not a dharamshala: Supreme Court junks Sri Lankan's plea against deportationThe petitioner, a Sri Lankan Tamil citizen, had sought protection from deportation, citing a threat to his life if he were to return to his home country.

Signals of strength: Meet woman officer who led from the front during Op SindoorThe woman officer from the Signals regiment recalled her experiences from the conflict, during which she and her team handled communication amongst various branches of the army, not only on the ground, but also in the air.

American Manhunt review: Riveting documentary about hunt for Laden that hits homeReleased-Wed May 14, 2025The timing of the release of 'American Manhunt - Osama bin Laden' on Netflix India may be coincidental. However, that's what exactly makes it feel so personal. The three-part documentary humanises the entire operation - the facts we know, the minds we don't.

How a one-eyed man foiled Nathuram Godse's plot to kill Mahatma GandhiNathuram Godse, born this day in 1910, originally planned to lob grenades at Mahatma Gandhi at a prayer meeting. His accomplices turned the conspiracy into a farce.

Indian-origin professor in UK loses OCI status over anti-India activitiesThe OCI status of UK-based Indian-origin academician Nitasha Kaul has been cancelled over "anti-India activities", driven by "malice and complete disregard for facts or history". The government notice was shared by Kaul, who was deported from Bengaluru airport last year within hours of her landing in India.

From pro-Pak videos to Bali trip: Haryana YouTuber's role in 'spy network' exposedHaryana YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra who was arrested for aiding Pakistan's spy agency was assigned tasks including vlogging, intel sharing, and travelling with operatives.

Open-top safari vehicles: Are they worth the risk in forest tourism?While most vehicles used in forest safaris are open-top, this raises a critical question: do they leave tourists vulnerable, and is it a risk worth taking?
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Sindoor ka saudagar: Congress steps up attack on S Jaishankar despite fact-checkRahul Gandhi once again reiterated his claims that India maintained silence over the loss of assets during Operation Sindoor, calling it a 'crime' to have informed Pakistan beforehand, while citing remarks made by S Jaishankar. Following his tweet, Congress leader Pawan Khera called BJP 'Sindoor ka saudagar' while playing Jaishankar's video byte.

Who is Ali Khan Mahmudabad, Ashoka University professor held over Op Sindoor post?Ali Khan Mahmudabad, a historian and Ashoka University professor, was arrested over a social media post on Operation Sindoor. He comes from a royal lineage and has a rich academic and political background.

'Boycott Turkey' hits fashion: Myntra, Ajio stop selling these Turkish labelsThe two leading online fashion platforms have removed Turkish products after growing boycott calls over Turkey's support to Pakistan during the recent India-Pakistan military conflict.

Baloch rebels release video of Jaffar Express hijack, counter Pak narrativeThe Baloch Liberation Army, a separatist group seeking Balochistan's secession from Pakistan, hijacked the Peshawar-bound Jaffar Express on March 11 after blowing up the railway tracks.
In numbers: The massive Covid-19 surge in Asian countriesHong Kong reported 1,042 cases in the week ending May 10. In the previous week, the number of cases was 972.

'Spy' YouTuber showed no remorse during probe, said she exercised free speech: CopsPost Pahalgam terror attack, Jyoti, who has 3.85 lakh subscribers on YouTube, put out a video claiming that it was not the fault of any Pakistani. 'She was asked to push the pro-Pakistani narrative, which is a new form of warfare,' sources revealed.

After Biden's prostate cancer diagnosis, questions about timeline, transparencyFormer US President Joe Biden has been diagnosed with advanced prostate cancer that has spread to his bones. Experts and doctors are debating how quickly the cancer could have progressed without earlier detection.
Who has armed drones?Four countries, led by Turkey, have exported armed drones to 48 countries, reshaping modern warfare.

Rohit Sharma gives away his Lamborghini to fantasy cricket contest winnerMumbai Indians opener Rohit Sharma gifted his prized Lamborghini Urus to a fantasy cricket contest winner. The giveaway fulfilled Rohit's viral promise, given at the start of the season.

A Bajrang Bali war cry and payback: How Rajput Regiment soldiers destroyed Pak postsIndia Today spoke to the Indian Army bravehearts stationed along the International Border in Jammu, who swiftly and resolutely countered Pakistan's attacks, inflicting heavy casualties and destroying enemy posts.

Polar bears in peril — biopsies shed light on Arctic pollution crisisHigh above the icy expanse of Norway's Svalbard archipelago, a helicopter hovers, a tranquilliser dart is fired, and a polar bear collapses into the snow — not as a trophy, but as a test subject. In a groundbreaking mission, scientists are collecting fat biopsies from these apex predators to study how persistent industrial pollutants, like PFAS chemicals, are silently infiltrating the Arctic food chain.

Top court rejects Minister's apology for Col Sofiya Qureshi remarks, orders probeThe Supreme Court on Monday constituted a Special Investigation Team of three IPS officers to investigate the FIR filed against Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah for his communal and offensive remarks against Army officer Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

Motivated: Supreme Court dismisses plea to mandate Karwa Chauth for all womenThe court sternly criticised the petition, labelling it as motivated, and said that it was "funded by actors who don't come forward themselves."

Netanyahu says Israel to control all of Gaza after launch of new ground assaultIsraeli PM Netanyahu vowed to take full control of Gaza amid intensified military operations, while global pressure mounts over a growing famine crisis. Airstrikes killed at least 22 as talks for a ceasefire and hostage deal remain stalled.

sports.headline: Hockey India starts player registration for Hero Hockey India League 2026Hockey India on May 19 announced that the registrations for the Hockey India League 2026 is now open. The closing date for the registrations for the new season is on August 20.

Rohit Sharma gives away his Lamborghini to fantasy cricket contest winnerMumbai Indians opener Rohit Sharma gifted his prized Lamborghini Urus to a fantasy cricket contest winner. The giveaway fulfilled Rohit's viral promise, given at the start of the season.

LSG vs SRH, IPL 2025 : Lucknow desperate to keep campaign alive vs HyderabadLSG vs SRH, IPL 2025 Live: Lucknow Super Giants are desperate to keep themselves alive in the playoffs race as they take on battered Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) in the upcoming fixture. The Rishabh Pant-led side will be eager to end their three-match losing streak in the upcoming fixture.

Serie A: Dates confirmed for Inter Milan and Napoli's title-deciding gamesInter Milan and Napoli learn the fate of their title-deciding clashes as Serie A enters its final weekend. Both teams are separated by just one point heading into the final game week in Italy.

BCCI hasn't taken any decision on Asia Cup participation yet: Devajit SaikiaBCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) secretary Devajit Saikia has revealed that India haven't had any discussions with the ACC (Asian Cricket Council) regarding their non-participation in the upcoming Asia Cup events scheduled this year.

Virat Kohli should've captained India in England Test series: Ravi ShastriFormer India cricketer and head coach Ravi Shastri feels that star India batter Virat Kohli should've played in the upcoming tour of England and even captained the team in the series.

Kevin Pietersen offers support when things aren't going right: DC's Abishek PorelAbishek Porel opened up on the influence of DC mentor Kevin Pietersen and said that the former England captain offers support when things aren't going right for the side. Delhi Capitals are going through a slump at the moment after their recent loss to GT.

Sai Sudharsan understands the game well: GT coach praises opener's consistencyGujarat Titans assistant coach Ashish Kapoor praised Sai Sudharsan for sticking to the traditional cricketing strokes, which helped him emerge as the top run-getter this IPL season.

Ajax manager Francesco Farioli steps down after historic title collapseFrancesco Farioli has left Ajax Amsterdam following a stunning late-season collapse that saw the club miss out on a record 37th Eredivisie title.

Danish Kaneria's photo removed from Jaipur stadium amid India-Pakistan tensionsFormer Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria's photo has been removed from the Sawai Man Singh Stadium in Jaipur amid the rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

Sai Sudharsan has outshone future India captain Shubman Gill: Ajay JadejaAjay Jadeja has claimed that Sai Sudharsan has outshone Shubman Gill during the IPL 2025 campaign after his hundred against DC on Sunday, May 18. Sudharsan remained unbeaten on 102 as GT thrashed DC by 10 wickets.

Danish Kaneria's photo removed from Jaipur stadium amid India-Pakistan tensionsFormer Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria's photo has been removed from the Sawai Man Singh Stadium in Jaipur amid the rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

Sai Sudharsan has outshone future India captain Shubman Gill: Ajay JadejaAjay Jadeja has claimed that Sai Sudharsan has outshone Shubman Gill during the IPL 2025 campaign after his hundred against DC on Sunday, May 18. Sudharsan remained unbeaten on 102 as GT thrashed DC by 10 wickets.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
